line.words: I capelli verdi e il ragazzo invisibile.

subtitle.line: Det grønne hår og den usynlige dreng
The Green Hair and The Invisible Boy
The Green Hair and The Invisible Boy
Het groene haar en de onzichtbare jongen

line.words: Ciao! Mi chiamo Johann. Sono triste. Sono triste perchè sono invisibile. C’è un immagine di me su quella pagina. Ma non mi vede

subtitle.line: Hej!Jeg hedder Johan. Jeg er ked af det. Jeg er ked af det, fordi jeg er usynlig. Der er et billede af mig på den side. Men du kan ikke se mig.
Hello!My name’s Johann. I’m sad. I’m sad because I am invisible. There is a picture of me on that page. But you can’t see me.
Hello!My name’s Johann. I’m sad. I’m sad because I am invisible. There is a picture of me on that page. But you can’t see me.
Hallo!Mijn naam is Johan. Ik ben verdrietig. Ik ben verdrietig omdat ik onzichtbaar ben. Er staat een foto van mij op die pagina. Maar jij ziet me niet.

line.words: Voglio che tutti mi vedono. Tutti ti vedono? Dovrebb’essere grande.

subtitle.line: Jeg vil gerne have, at alle kan se mig. Kan alle se dig? Det må være dejligt.
I want everybody to be able to see me. Can everyone see you? It must be great.
I want everybody to be able to see me. Can everyone see you? It must be great.
Ik wil dat iedereen mij kan zien. Kan iedereen jou wel zien? Dat lijkt me geweldig.

line.words: Voglio che tutti vedono il piede quando gioco a calcio… la mano quando scrivo… la testa quando parlo… la gamba quando cammino e le spalle quando scrollo. Ma non possono.

subtitle.line: Jeg vil gerne have, at alle kan se min fod, når jeg spiller fodbold...min hånd, når jeg skriver...mit hoved, når jeg snakker...mit ben, når jeg går og mine skuldre, når jeg trækker på dem. Men det kan de ikke.
I want everybody to see my foot when I play football… my hand when I write… my head when I talk… my leg when I walk and my shoulders when I shrug. But they can’t.
I want everybody to see my foot when I play football… my hand when I write… my head when I talk… my leg when I walk and my shoulders when I shrug. But they can’t.

Ik wil dat iedereen mijn voet ziet wanneer ik aan het voetballen ben… mijn hand wanneer ik schrijf… mijn gezicht wanneer ik praat… mijn benen wanneer ik loop en mijn schouders wanneer ik ze ophaal. Maar ze zien me niet.

line.words: “Perchè non fai una ricerca per visibilità, Johann?” dice sua madre. “Che cos’è una ricerca?” “È quando si mette in viaggio per cercare qualcosa” dice sua madre. “Si, lo faccio!”

subtitle.line: “Hvorfor tager du ikke på rejse efter synlighed, Johan?, siger Johans mor.”“Hvad for en rejse?”“En rejse, hvor du leder efter noget”, siger Johans mor.“Det vil jeg gøre”
‘Why don’t you go on a quest for visibility, Johann?’ Says Johann’s mum. ‘What is a quest?’ ‘It’s when you go on a journey to look for something.’ Says Johann’s mum.‘Yes! I will.’
‘Why don’t you go on a quest for visibility, Johann?’ Says Johann’s mum. ‘What is a quest?’ ‘It’s when you go on a journey to look for something.’ Says Johann’s mum.‘Yes! I will.’

‘Waarom maak je niet een zoektocht naar zichtbaarheid, Johan?’ zegt Johans moeder.‘Wat is een zoektocht naar zichtbaarheid?’ ‘Dat is wanneer je op zoek gaat naar een manier zodat iedereen je kan zien, zegt Johans moeder.‘Ja, dat ga ik doen!’

line.words: “Comincio la mia ricerca a scuola” Lungo la strada a scuola, Johann canta un canzone. “Rosso e giallo e rosa e verde, viola e arancione e blu, vedo un arcobaleno, ma nessuno mi vede.”

subtitle.line: “Jeg begynder rejsen på skolen.”På vej til skole synger Johan en sang.“Rød og gul og rosa og grøn, lilla og orange og blå. Jeg kan se en regnbue, men jeg kan ikke se mig selv.”
‘I’ll start my quest at school’ On the way to school, Johann sings a song.‘Red and yellow and pink and green, purple and orange and blue, I can see a rainbow, but I can’t see me.’
‘I’ll start my quest at school’ On the way to school, Johann sings a song.‘Red and yellow and pink and green, purple and orange and blue, I can see a rainbow, but I can’t see me.’
‘Ik begin mijn zoektocht op school.’Op weg naar school zingt Johan een liedje.‘Rood en geel en roze en groen, paars en oranje en blauw, ik zie een regenboog, maar ik zie mezelf niet.’

line.words: Gli piace cantare quando cammina. Lo fa sentiré più visibile e meno triste.

subtitle.line: Han kan godt lide at synge, mens han går. Det får ham til at føle sig mere synlig og mindre ked af det.
He likes to sing as he walks. It helps to make him feel more visible and less sad.
He likes to sing as he walks. It helps to make him feel more visible and less sad.
Hij zingt graag tijdens het lopen. Het maakt hem minder verdrietig en geeft hem het gevoel dat mensen hem zien.

line.words: Johann incontra i suoi compagni di classe a scuola. Prima di mettersi in viaggio, decide di saperne di più come sembrano diverse persone.

subtitle.line: Johan møder sine klassekammerater på skolen. Han beslutter sig for, inden han rejser, at han vil finde ud af, hvor forskellige folk ser ud.
Johann meets his classmates at school. He decides that before he goes on his quest, he will find out about the different ways people look.
Johann meets his classmates at school. He decides that before he goes on his quest, he will find out about the different ways people look.
Johan ziet zijn klasgenoten op school. Voordat hij op zoektocht gaat, wil hij uitzoeken hoe andere mensen eruitzien.

line.words: “Ciao, Jennifer. Come sembri?” “Ciao, Johann. Ho gli occhi castani e i capelli marroni”

subtitle.line: “Hej Jennifer. Hvordan ser du ud?”“Hej Johan. Jeg har brune øjne og brunt hår”.
‘Hi Jennifer. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have brown eyes and brown hair.’
‘Hi Jennifer. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have brown eyes and brown hair.’
‘Hoi Jennifer. Hoe zie jij eruit?’‘Hoi Johan. Ik heb bruine ogen en bruin haar.’

line.words: “Ciao, Marvel. Come sembri?” “Ciao, Johann. Ho gli occhi verdi e i capelli neri”

subtitle.line: “Hej Marvel. Hvordan ser du ud?” “Hej Johan. Jeg har grønne øjne og sort hår”.
‘Hi Marvel. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have green eyes and black hair.’
‘Hi Marvel. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have green eyes and black hair.’
‘Hoi Martin. Hoe zie jij eruit?’‘Hoi Johan. Ik heb groene ogen en zwart haar.’

line.words: “Ciao, Tom. Come sembri?” “Ciao, Johann. Ho gli occhi azzurri e i capelli rossi”

subtitle.line: “Hej Tom. Hvordan ser du ud?” “Hej Johan. Jeg har blå øjne og rødt hår”.
‘Hi Tom. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have blue eyes and ginger hair.’
‘Hi Tom. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have blue eyes and ginger hair.’
‘Hoi Tom. Hoe zie jij eruit?’‘Hoi Johan. Ik heb blauwe ogen en rood haar.’

line.words: Finalmente chiede a Mo. “Ciao, Mo. Come sembri?” “Ciao, Johann. Ho gli occhi castani e i capelli biondi” “Tutti i miei amici sembrano diverso” dice Johann. “Mi piacerebbe sembrare anch’io diverso”

subtitle.line: Til sidst spørger han Mo. “Hej Mo. Hvordan ser du ud?” “Hej Johan. Jeg har brune øjne og lyst hår”. “Mine venner ser forskellige ud”, tænker Johan. “Jeg vil også se anderledes ud”.
Finally he asks Mo. ‘Hi Mo. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have brown eyes and blond hair.’ ‘My friends all look different’ says Johann. ‘I want to look different too.’
Finally he asks Mo. ‘Hi Mo. What do you look like?’ ‘Hi Johann. I have brown eyes and blond hair.’ ‘My friends all look different’ says Johann. ‘I want to look different too.’

Als laatste vraagt hij Moniek. ‘Hoi Moniek. Hoe zie jij eruit?’‘Hoi Johan. Ik heb bruine ogen en blond haar.’‘Mijn vrienden zien er allemaal verschillend uit’ denkt Johan. ‘Ik wil er ook anders uitzien.’

line.words: “Dove comincio la mia ricerca” chiede Johann al suo professore. “Vai via e trova l’antica bestia delle montagne” dice il suo professore. “L’antica bestia sa molto perchè è cosi vecchia.”

subtitle.line: “Hvor skal jeg starte min rejse?”, spørger Johan sin lærer.“Du skal finde det ældgamle uhyre i bjergene”, siger hans lærer. “Det ældgamle uhyre ved så meget, fordi han er så gammel”.
‘Where shall I start my quest?’ Johann asks his teacher. ‘Go and find the ancient beast of the mountains’ his teacher says. ‘The ancient beast knows a lot because he is so old.’
‘Where shall I start my quest?’ Johann asks his teacher. ‘Go and find the ancient beast of the mountains’ his teacher says. ‘The ancient beast knows a lot because he is so old.’
‘Waar zal ik mijn zoektocht beginnen?’ vraagt Johan aan zijn leraar. ‘Zoek het oude beest in de bergen’ zegt zijn leraar. ‘Het oude beest weet heel veel omdat hij zo oud is.’

line.words: E cosi Johann cominica la sua ricerca. Cammina e cammina verso le montagne. Quando cammina canta il suo canzone.

subtitle.line: Så begynder Johan sin rejse. Han går og han går hen imod bjergene. Mens han går, synger han sin sang.
And so Johann begins his quest. He walks and he walks, towards the mountains. As he walks he sings his song.
And so Johann begins his quest. He walks and he walks, towards the mountains. As he walks he sings his song.
En zo begint Johan aan zijn zoektocht. Hij loopt en loopt, richting de bergen. Tijdens het lopen zingt hij zijn liedje.

line.words: “Rosso e giallo e rosa e verde, viola e arancione e blu, vedo un arcobaleno, ma nessuno mi vede. Ancora.”

subtitle.line: “Rød og gul og rosa og grøn, lilla og orange og blå. Jeg kan se en regnbue, men jeg kan ikke se mig selv. Endnu.”
§What can I give the ancient beast of the mountains?§ thinks Johann. He sits down and eats an almond. Then an orange bird appears and sings to him. §Offer him your almonds.§

line.words: Lungo la strada alle montagne, Johann si avvincina un fiume. Nel fiume vede un grande pesce azzurro. Il grande pesce azzurro balza dall’azqua e parla a Johann.

subtitle.line: På vej til bjergene kommer Johan til en flod. I floden kan han se en stor blå fisk. Den store blå fisk hopper op af vandet og taler til Johan!
On the way to the mountains, Johann comes to a river. In the river he sees a big blue fish. The big blue fish jumps out of the water and speaks to Johann!
On the way to the mountains, Johann comes to a river. In the river he sees a big blue fish. The big blue fish jumps out of the water and speaks to Johann!
Op weg naar de bergen, komt Johan langs een rivier. In de rivier ziet hij een grote blauwe vis. De grote blauwe vis springt uit het water en praat tegen Johan!

line.words: “Se vuoi l’aiuto dell’antica bestia delle montagne, gli devi portare un regalo” dice il pesce, e sparisce.

subtitle.line: “Hvis du vil have, at det ældgamle uhyre i bjergene skal hjælpe dig, skal du tage en gave med til ham”, siger fisken og forsvinder.
‘If you want the ancient beast of the mountains to help you, you must take a present to him’ says the fish, and disappears.
‘If you want the ancient beast of the mountains to help you, you must take a present to him’ says the fish, and disappears.
‘Als je wilt dat het oude beest je helpt, moet je een cadeautje voor hem meenemen’ zegt de vis, en dan verdwijnt hij.

line.words: “Cosa posso regolare all’antica bestia delle montagne” pensa Johann. Si sede e mangia una mandorla. Poi un uccello arancione apparisce e canta a lui. “Gli regola le mandorle”.

subtitle.line: “Hvad kan jeg give det ældgamle uhyre i bjergene?”, tænker Johan. Han sætter sig ned og spiser en mandel. Så kommer der en orange fugl og synger for ham: “Giv ham nogle af dine mandler”.
‘What can I give the ancient beast of the mountains?’ thinks Johann. He sits down and eats an almond. Then an orange bird appears and sings to him. ‘Offer him your almonds.’
‘What can I give the ancient beast of the mountains?’ thinks Johann. He sits down and eats an almond. Then an orange bird appears and sings to him. ‘Offer him your almonds.’
‘Wat kan ik het oude beest geven?’ denkt Johan. Hij gaat zitten en eet een amandelnootje. Dan verschijnt er een oranje vogel die voor hem begint te zingen. ‘Geef hem wat amandelen.’

line.words: Johann guarda alle mandorle. “Un buon’idea! Grazie uccello!” Johann continua il suo viaggio nelle montagne.

subtitle.line: Johan kigger på sine mandler. “God idé. Tak fugl!” Johan fortsætter rejsen til bjergene.
Johann looks at his almonds. ‘A great idea! Thank you bird!’ Johann continues his journey into the mountains.
Johann looks at his almonds. ‘A great idea! Thank you bird!’ Johann continues his journey into the mountains.
Johan kijkt naar zijn amandelen. ‘Goed idee! Dank je wel, vogel!’ Johan loopt verder richting de bergen.

line.words: Johann cammina per sette ore nelle montagne e alle cime dove abitano le antiche bestie delle montagne.

subtitle.line: Johan går i syv timer, ind i bjergene og til toppen, hvor det ældgamle uhyre i bjergene bor.
Johann walks for seven hours, into the mountains and to the peaks where the ancient beasts of the mountains live.
Johann walks for seven hours, into the mountains and to the peaks where the ancient beasts of the mountains live.
Johan loopt zeven uur achter elkaar, tot hij aankomt in de bergen waar het oude beest leeft.

line.words: Vede l’antica bestia delle montagne! Ha una coda verde…

subtitle.line: Han ser det ældgamle uhyre i bjergene!Han har en grøn hale...
He sees the ancient beast of the mountains! He has a green tail…
He sees the ancient beast of the mountains! He has a green tail…
Hij ziet het oude beest! Hij heeft een groene staart…

line.words: E ha dei denti feroci...

subtitle.line: Han har grumme tænder…
He has ferocious teeth…
He has ferocious teeth…
Hij heeft enorme tanden…

line.words: Ha dei corni arancioni e gialli…

subtitle.line: Han har orange og gule horn...
He has orange and yellow horns…
He has orange and yellow horns…
Hij heeft oranje en gele hoorns…

line.words: Ha gli artigli terribili...

subtitle.line: Han har frygtelige kløer…
He has terrible claws…
He has terrible claws…
Hij heeft grote klauwen…

line.words: E ha i capelli lunghi marroni che coprano il viso!

subtitle.line: Og han har langt brunt hår, der dækker hans ansigt!
And he has long brown hair that covers his face!
And he has long brown hair that covers his face!
En hij heeft lang bruin haar dat zijn gezicht bedekt!

line.words: “Ciao!” dice Johann. “Ho delle mandorle per te”. Offre le mandorle all’antica bestia delle montagne. “Voglio essere visibile. Puoi aiutarmi?”

subtitle.line: “Hej”, siger Johan. “Jeg har nogle mandler til dig”. Han giver mandlerne til det ældgamle uhyre i bjergene. “Jeg vil gerne være synlig. Kan du hjælpe mig?”
‘Hello!’ says Johann. ‘I have some almonds for you.’ He offers the almonds to the ancient beast of the mountains. ‘I want to be visible. Can you help me?’
‘Hello!’ says Johann. ‘I have some almonds for you.’ He offers the almonds to the ancient beast of the mountains. ‘I want to be visible. Can you help me?’
‘Hallo!’ zegt Johan. ‘Ik heb amandelen voor u meegenomen.’ Hij geeft het oude beest de amandelen. ‘Ik wil graag zichtbaar zijn. Kunt u me helpen?’

line.words: “Odio le mandorle!” urla l’antica bestia. “ma è il pensiero che conta! Ti posso aiutare. Vuoi essere visibile? Ti dò la visibilità. Nessuno non ti vede!”

subtitle.line: “Jeg hader mandler!”, brøler det ældgamle uhyre. ”Men det er tanken, der tæller. Jeg kan hjælpe dig. Du vil gerne være synlig? Jeg vil give dig synlighed. Ingen vil kunne overse dig!”
‘I hate almonds!’ roars the ancient beast. ‘But it is the thought that counts! I can help you. You want to be visible? I will give you visibility. No-one will be able to miss you!’
‘I hate almonds!’ roars the ancient beast. ‘But it is the thought that counts! I can help you. You want to be visible? I will give you visibility. No-one will be able to miss you!’
‘Ik haat amandelen!’ brult het oude beest. ‘Maar je bedoelt het goed. Ik kan je helpen. Jij wilt zichtbaar zijn? Ik geef je zichtbaarheid. Niemand zal om je heen kunnen!’

line.words: Torna a casa. Quando arrivi, guarda nello specchio.

subtitle.line: Tag hjem. Når du kommer hjem, skal du se dig I spejlet.
Go home. When you get there, look in the mirror.
Go home. When you get there, look in the mirror.
‘Ga naar huis. Als je thuis bent, kijk je in de spiegel.’

line.words: Johann lascia l’antica bestia delle montagne. “Grazie” dice.

subtitle.line: Johan forlader det ældgamle uhyre i bjergene. “Tak”, siger han
Johann leaves the ancient beast of the mountains. ‘Thank you!’ he says.
Johann leaves the ancient beast of the mountains. ‘Thank you!’ he says.
Johan verlaat het oude beest. ‘dank je wel!’ zegt hij.

line.words: Sale giù le montagne.

subtitle.line: Han går ned ad bjerget.
He walks back down the mountains.
He walks back down the mountains.
Hij loopt de bergen af.

line.words: Cammina davanti al fiume. “Grazie” dice al uccello arancione. “Grazie” dice al grande pesce azzurro.”

subtitle.line: Han går forbi floden. ”Tak”, siger han til den orange fugl. ”Tak”, siger han til den store blå fisk.
He walks past the river. ‘Thank you!’ he says to the orange bird. ‘Thank you!’ he says to the big blue fish.
He walks past the river. ‘Thank you!’ he says to the orange bird. ‘Thank you!’ he says to the big blue fish.
Hij loopt langs de rivier. ‘Dank je wel!’ zegt hij tegen de oranje vogel. ‘Dank je wel!’ zegt hij tegen de grote blauwe vis.

line.words: Finalmente arriva a casa. Prende lo specchio. Guarda nello specchio.

subtitle.line: Endelig er han hjemme. Han går hen til spejlet. Han ser ind i spejlet.
Finally he arrives home. He goes to the mirror. He looks in the mirror.
Finally he arrives home. He goes to the mirror. He looks in the mirror.
Eindelijk komt hij thuis. Hij loopt naar de spiegel. Hij kijkt in de spiegel.

line.words: “Ho i capelli verdi! E ho corni! E ho gli occhiali!” È vero. Fine.

subtitle.line: “Jeg har grønt hår! Og jeg har horn! Og jeg har briller!” Og det havde han. Slut.
‘I have green hair! And I have horns! And I have glasses!’ And so he did. The end.
‘I have green hair! And I have horns! And I have glasses!’ And so he did. The end.
‘Ik heb groen haar! En ik heb hoorns! En ik heb een bril!’ En zo was hij zichtbaar... Einde.
